sql-script.tran-sql: create table sf_workflow_model ( id char(32) not null, modelname varchar2(64 char) not null, modelver varchar2(16 char) not null, modeltext varchar2(128 char), status number(4) not null, userid char(32) not null, usertext varchar2(32) not null, createdate timestamp not null, lastupdate timestamp, processcount number(11) not null, primary key(id), unique(modelname) );
create table sf_workflow_model_domain ( id char(32) not null, modelid char(32) not null, domainid char(32) not null, processcount number(11) not null, primary key(id), unique(modelid, domainid) );

create table sf_workflow_process ( id char(32) not null, modelid char(32) not null, modelname varchar2(64 char) not null, version varchar2(16 char) not null, title varchar2(128 char), pno varchar2(64 char), ppriority number(4) not null, status number(4) not null, userid char(32), deptid char(32), domainid char(32), usertext varchar2(32 char), createdate timestamp not null, roleid char(32), completedate timestamp, timeoutdate timestamp, comments number(11) not null, views number(11) not null, properties varchar2(4000 char), primary key(id) );

create table sf_workflow_delegation ( id char(32) not null, delegationsource number(4) not null, sourceid char(32) not null, status number(4) not null, createdate timestamp not null, ouserid char(32) not null, ousertext varchar2(32) not null, userid char(32) not null, usertext varchar2(32) not null, startdate timestamp, completedate timestamp, dstartdate timestamp, dcompletedate timestamp, timeoutmark number(1) not null, rulehandler varchar2(128 char), description varchar2(256 char), description2 varchar2(256 char), primary key(id) );

create table sf_workflow_activity ( id char(32) not null, processid char(32) not null, previousid char(32), tasknodeid char(32) not null, tasknodetext varchar2(64) not null, tasknodetype number(4) not null, status number(4) not null, createdate timestamp not null, completedate timestamp, timeoutdate timestamp, properties varchar2(4000 char), primary key(id) );

create table sf_workflow_workitem ( id char(32) not null, processid char(32) not null, activityid char(32) not null, status number(4) not null, roleid char(32) not null, userid char(32) not null, usertext varchar2(32) not null, deptid char(32), domainid char(32), userid2 char(32) not null, usertext2 varchar2(32), deptid2 char(32), createdate timestamp not null, completedate timestamp, readmark number(1) not null, readdate timestamp, topmark number(1) not null, fallbackid char(32), retakeid char(32), retakeref char(32), ext1 varchar2(64 char), ext2 number(11) not null, primary key(id) );

create table sf_workflow_userstat ( id char(32) not null, userid char(32) not null, workitem_running number(11) not null, workitem_suspended number(11) not null, workitem_delegate number(11) not null, workitem_complete number(11) not null, workitem_abort number(11) not null, workitem_retake number(11) not null, workitem_unread number(11) not null, workview_unread number(11) not null, primary key(id) );

create table sf_workflow_variable ( id char(32) not null, variablesource number(4) not null, sourceid char(32) not null, variablename varchar2(32 char) not null, stringvalue varchar2(128 char), clobvalue varchar2(4000 char), primary key(id), unique(variablesource, sourceid, variablename) );

create table sf_workflow_variable_log ( id char(32) not null, variableid char(32) not null, createdate timestamp not null, userid char(32) not null, stringvalue varchar2(128 char), clobvalue varchar2(4000 char), primary key(id) );

create table sf_workflow_workview ( id char(32) not null, sentid char(32) not null, parentid char(32), processid char(32) not null, workitemid char(32) not null, userid char(32) not null, usertext varchar2(32 char) not null, deptid char(32), domainid char(32), createdate timestamp not null, readmark number(1) not null, readdate timestamp, topmark number(1) not null, ext1 varchar2(64 char), ext2 number(11) not null, primary key(id), unique(processid, userid) );

create table sf_workflow_workview_sent ( id char(32) not null, workviewid char(32), processid char(32) not null, workitemid char(32) not null, userid char(32) not null, usertext varchar2(32 char) not null, domainid char(32), createdate timestamp not null, primary key(id) );

create table sf_workflow_comment ( id char(32) not null, contentid char(32) not null, createdate timestamp not null, userid char(32) not null, workitemid char(32) not null, deptid char(32) not null, taskname varchar2(64 char), ccomment varchar2(2000 char) not null, primary key(id) );

create table sf_workflow_comment_user ( id char(32) not null, contentid char(32) not null, createdate timestamp not null, userid char(32) not null, ncomments number(11) not null, primary key(id), unique(contentid, userid) );

create table sf_workflow_comment_log ( id char(32) not null, commentid char(32), createdate timestamp not null, userid char(32) not null, logtype number(4) not null, ccomment varchar2(2000 char) not null, primary key(id) );

create table sf_workflow_notice ( id char(32) not null, createdate timestamp not null, userid char(32) not null, processid char(32) not null, status number(4) not null, typeno number(11) not null, workitemid char(32), sentkey varchar2(64 char), dsentdate timestamp not null, sentdate timestamp, sents number(11) not null, smessage varchar2(2000 char), primary key(id), unique(userid, sentkey) );
